* Hold dofetilide for now

* Monitor on telemetry

* Follow up with transesophageal echocardiogram (TTE) today
* Hold home dose of PO lasix and give IV lasix prn
* Monitor electrolytes closely

* No history of coronary artery disease (CAD)
* Clean coronaries on cath 6 months ago
* Hypertension: continue metoprolol 37.5mg TID
* Continue lipitor and tricor for hyperlipidemia

* Worsening of hypokalemia and magnesium deficiency
* Prolonged QT interval leading to torsades de pointes
* Acute pulmonary edema due to diastolic heart failure
* Ischemia or infarction due to prolonged QT interval
* Bleeding complications due to warfarin therapy
* Electrolyte imbalance due to IV lasix therapy
* Cardiac arrhythmias due to dofetilide therapy
* Increased risk of stroke or bleeding due to warfarin therapy
